concept.name: Person demographics
concept.description: The person's details and contact information.

concept.name: Person name
concept.description: Details of the person's name

concept.name: Person first name
concept.description: The first name(s) of the person. This includes middle names.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person given name

concept.name: Person family name
concept.description: The family name or surname of the person
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Person family name

concept.name: Person preferred name
concept.description: The name by which a person wishes to be addressed. The preferred name volunteered by the person or a preferred name given by PDS that the person has asked to be called by.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Person full name

concept.name: Title
concept.description: Person's title
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Person title

concept.name: Person name suffix
concept.description: A textual suffix that may be added to the end of a PERSON's name, for example, OBE, MBE, BSc, JP, GM
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Person suffix

concept.name: Person full name
concept.description: The full name of the person in text representation.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Patient full name

concept.name: Date of birth
concept.description: The date of birth of the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- Person birth date

concept.name: Gender
concept.description: The person's stated gender.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person stated gender code

concept.name: Person alias
concept.description: Other name(s) associated with the person.

concept.name: Ethnicity
concept.description: The ethnicity of the person as specified by the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Ethnic category

concept.name: Religion
concept.description: The religious affiliation as specified by the person.

concept.name: Sex
concept.description: The person’s phenotypic sex. Determines how the person will be treated clinically.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - person phenotypic sex

concept.name: NHS number
concept.description: The unique identifier for a person within the NHS in England and Wales.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- NHS number

concept.name: Other identifier
concept.description: Country specific or local identifier, e.g. Community Health Index (CHI) in Scotland.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Local patient identifier(extended), Health and care number (NI only), Community health index number (Scotland only)

concept.name: Person's address
concept.description: Person’s usual place of residence, and where relevant temporary and correspondence addresses.

concept.name: Address line 1
concept.description: Person's first line of address.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :-  Address line 1

concept.name: Address line 2
concept.description: Person's second line of address.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Address line 2

concept.name: Address line 3
concept.description: Person's third line of address.

concept.name: Address line 4
concept.description: Person's fourth line of address.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Address line 4

concept.name: Address line 5
concept.description: Person's fifth line of address.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Address line 5

concept.name: Postcode
concept.description: The person's postcode.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Postcode of usual address

concept.name: Address type
concept.description: The type of address e.g. Main address, Temp address
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Address association type

concept.name: Person's contact details
concept.description: Details of the person's contact information.

concept.name: Preferred contact method
concept.description: Preferred contact method, e.g. email, letter, phone, text message etc.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Communication contact method

concept.name: Person's telephone number details
concept.description: The person's telephone number details

concept.name: Person's telephone number
concept.description: The person's telephone number
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - UK telephone number

concept.name: Person's telephone number type
concept.description: The contact type e.g. home, mobile
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set: - Contact point use

concept.name: Preference of telephone number
concept.description: The preferred order of use for the telephone number
concept.valueSets: Preference of use 1-5, 1 being the highest.

concept.name: Person's email address details
concept.description: Details of the person's email address

concept.name: Person's email address
concept.description: Email address of the person.

concept.name: Person's email address type
concept.description: The type of email address, home, work
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set: - Contact point use

concept.name: Preference of email address
concept.description: The preferred order of use of email address
concept.valueSets: Preference of use 1-5, 1 being the highest.

concept.name: Other contact information
concept.description: Contact details via fax, sms, url
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- Communication contact string

concept.name: Place of birth
concept.description: The country of birth of the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Country code (birth)

concept.name: Marital status
concept.description: An indicator to identify the legal marital status of the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person marital status

concept.name: GP practice
concept.description: Details of the person's GP practice.

concept.name: GP practice record entry
concept.description: This is an GP practice record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items

concept.name: GP name
concept.description: The name of the person's GP. If the person is registered with a GP practice, their usual GP name will be something volunteered by the person or their representative.

concept.name: GP practice details
concept.description: Name and address of the person's registered GP practice Registered GP practice details are available from the Person Demographics Service (PDS), or volunteered from the person or their representative. Include details of the practice name and address.

concept.name: GP practice identifier
concept.description: The identifier of the registered GP practice.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - General medical practice code (patient registration)

concept.name: About me
concept.description: About me

concept.name: What is most important to me
concept.description: A description of what is most important to you. <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: What is most important to me
concept.description:
A description of what is most important to you 
 Emergency Information : -  Include any essential information that any professional in health and social care should know about the you in any situation, including emergencies.
Other Information : - This could include : - Values, Spirituality/religion, Ethnicity, Culture, Pets, Goals and aspirations, Meaningful activities including leisure activities, visiting places, sport and exercise, listening to music, employment, education, volunteering

concept.name: People who are important to me
concept.description: Details of who is important to you and why.

concept.name: People who are important to me
concept.description: Details of who is important to you and why. They could be family members, carers, friends, members of staff etc. Include how you want the people important to you to be engaged and involved in your care and support in both emergency and normal situations. Include how you stay connected to the people important to you. Who should not be contacted or consulted about your care and support and why, if you wish to say

concept.name: How I communicate and how to communicate with me
concept.description: A description of how you communicate normally.

concept.name: How I communicate and how to communicate with me
concept.description:
A description of how you communicate normally including any communication aids you use, for example a hearing aid.

  • Include your preferred language of communication, if your first language is not English.
  • Include how you would communicate when you are in pain or distress.
  • Include how you communicate choices.
  • Include how you give feedback or raise a concern.
  • Include how you like to receive information

Describe how you would like others to engage and communicate with you, including how you would like to be addressed.

concept.name: My wellness
concept.description: A description covering what you are able to do, how you engage with others and how you feel on a typical day through to on a day when you are unwell or really unwell.

concept.name: My wellness
concept.description:
A description covering what you are able to do, how you engage with others and how you feel on a typical day through to on a day when you are unwell or really unwell

  • Include any causes that might result in you becoming unwell and strategies for avoiding or addressing the causes. For example, not drinking enough water could cause constipation.
  • Include any signs that indicate you might be becoming unwell.
  • On a bad day describe what is different about what you are able to do, how you engage with others and how you feel.
  • Include how your everyday life is affected by any medical conditions e.g. dementia and any symptoms e.g. itchiness, cough, pain and how you manage those conditions.
  • Include past health issues or experiences that need to be considered
  • Include your wellbeing and lifestyle goals and aspirations

concept.name: Please do and please don't
concept.description: A description of things you want someone supporting you to do (or not to do).

concept.name: Please do and please don't
concept.description:
A description of things you want someone supporting you to do (or not to do).
Things you want someone to  do  might include (for example): - Talk to me not to my carer, remind me to take my medication, encourage me to wash my hands regularly, explain to me what is happening and why, respond to my communication.
A description of things you  do not  want someone supporting you to do might include (for example): - Discussing or asking questions about certain topics, making assumptions about something, providing support when it is not wanted, talking to you in a certain way, undergoing a specific intervention or taking a medication the person does not want.

concept.name: How and when to support me
concept.description: A description of how and when you want someone caring for you to support you.

concept.name: How and when to support me
concept.description:
A description of how and when you want someone caring for you to support you.

  • This could include support needs in an emergency situation (for example taking blood)
  • This could include support you need to maintain important routines or to carry out particular activities, for example: - Personal care routines, Eating and drinking, Bedtime routines, Taking medications, Moving and transitioning
  • This could also include support needed with:- wearing glasses/hearing aids/false teeth etc, making informed choices or understanding dangers and risks, managing your emotions, moods and behaviours, memory or confusion.
  • Include how your support needs change in different environments. Include any triggers that might result in you needing further support and strategies for avoiding or addressing the triggers. Include how you want the support to be provided.

concept.name: Also worth knowing about me
concept.description: A description of what is also worth knowing about you for people caring or supporting you.

concept.name: Also worth knowing about me
concept.description:
A description of what is also worth knowing about you for people caring or supporting you.

  • This could include a short history of your life (where you have worked, where you lived, important events in your life, important people in your past life).
  • This could include a short profile of your current life:- your work / study, your aspirations, your skills, your networks, things you like e.g. particular foods, places, a football team and things you like to talk about, things you dislike
  • This could also include any care and support preferences that have not been included elsewhere.

concept.name: Date
concept.description: This is a record of the date that this information was last updated.

concept.name: Supported to write this by
concept.description: Where relevant, this is a record of name, relationship/role and contact details of the individual who supported the person to write this section e.g. carer, family member, advocate, professional.

concept.name: Location to multimedia file
concept.description: The link to the person's multimedia file

concept.name: Professional contacts
concept.description: The details of the person’s professional contacts.

concept.name: Professional contacts record entry
concept.description: This is a professional contacts record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional with responsibility for the care of the person.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker, key worker, care home manager, care coordinator, LA hospital liaison person, care home contact, hospital clinician, Independent Mental Capacity Advocate (IMCA) etc

concept.name: Key worker
concept.description: A flag that identifies the personal contact is the key worker assigned to the person.

concept.name: Speciality
concept.description: The specialty of the professional e.g. physiotherapy, oncology, mental health etc
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Team
concept.description: The name of the team.

concept.name: Organisation
concept.description: The name of the organisation.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for location
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Organisation data service

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the professional (e.g. telephone number, email address etc.).

concept.name: Start date
concept.description: The start date of the professional relationship with the person.

concept.name: End date
concept.description: The end date of the professional relationship with the person.

concept.name: Personal contacts
concept.description: The details of the individual's personal contacts.

concept.name: Personal contacts record entry
concept.description: This is personal contacts record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the personal contact.

concept.name: Relationship
concept.description: The relationship the personal contact has to the person, e.g. father, grandmother, family friend etc.
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set : - Related person

concept.name: Relationship type
concept.description: Additional roles the person performs on behalf of the other (e.g. Carer, Next of Kin, Emergency Contact, Dependent, etc.)

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the personal contact (e.g. telephone number, email address etc.)

concept.name: Comments
concept.description: Notes on the significance of the personal contact to the person.

concept.name: Formulation
concept.description: Details of the person's formulation.

concept.name: Formulation record entry
concept.description: This is the formulation record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Date
concept.description: The date the formulation was made.

concept.name: Location
concept.description: The location where the formulation was made.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Organisation data service

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for location
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Organisation data service

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: Performing professional
concept.description: The professional who made the formulation.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker etc
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set :- SDSjobroletype

concept.name: Grade
concept.description: The grade of the professional.

concept.name: Speciality
concept.description: The specialty of the professional e.g. physiotherapy, oncology, mental health etc
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary - Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Professional identifier
concept.description: Professional identifier for the professional e.g. GMC number, HCPC number etc or the personal identifier used by the local organisation.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Professional registration identifier

concept.name: Organisation
concept.description: The name of the organisation the professional works for.

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the professional
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary - UK phone number

concept.name: Formulation
concept.description: An account, shared by a therapist and person, of the personal meaning and origins of a person’s difficulties. This is viewed in the context of multiple factors including relationships, social circumstances and life events and will indicate the most helpful way forward.

concept.name: Person completing record
concept.description: Details of the person completing the record.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the person completing the record.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The organisational role of the person completing record.

concept.name: Grade
concept.description: The grade of the person completing the record.

concept.name: Specialty
concept.description: The main specialty of the person completing the record.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Activity treatment function code

concept.name: Organisation
concept.description: The organisation the person completing the record works for.

concept.name: Professional identifier
concept.description: Professional identifier for the person completing the record e.g. GMC number, HCPC number etc, or the personal identifier used by the local organisation.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Professional registration identifier

concept.name: Date completed
concept.description: The date and time the record was completed.

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the person completing the record. <br clear="none"/>
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - UK telephone number

concept.name: Care and support plan
concept.description: This records the decisions reached during conversation between the individual and health and care professional about future plans and also records progress.

concept.name: Strengths
concept.description: Any strengths and assets the person has relating to their goals and hopes about their health and well-being.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value associated with the person's strengths.  Could be derived from the assessment of the person e.g. 300738008 |Able to participate in leisure activities (finding)|
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - 1127601000000107 | Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the person's strengths.

concept.name: Needs, concerns or problems
concept.description: Details of the person needs, concerns or problems <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value associated with the person's needs, concerns or problems.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : -  ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Any supplementary or personalised information that relates to the person's needs, concerns and problems.

concept.name: Goals and hopes
concept.description: The overall goals, hopes, aims or targets that the person has. Including anything that the person wants to achieve that relates to their future health and wellbeing. Each goal may include a description of why it is important to the person. Goals may also be ranked in order of importance or priority to the person.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value associated with the person's goals, aim's and hopes. e.g. 999002111000000103 |Occupational therapy goals simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - 413350009|Finding with explicit context|: 246090004|Associated finding|=300798006 |Able to participate in sporting activities (finding)|, 408729009|Finding context|=410518001|Goal|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Any supplementary and personalised information relating to the person's goals, aims and hopes.

concept.name: Goal importance score
concept.description: Assessment of the person's motivations to achieve this goal, how important the goal is to the person on a scale of 1-10.

concept.name: Actions and activities
concept.description: Actions or activities the person or others plan to take to achieve the person's goals and the resources required to do this.  <p/>

concept.name: What
concept.description: What the action is and how it is to be carried out?

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the action.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - << 71388002  |Procedure| OR << 129125009  |Procedure with explicit context|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Any supplementary and personalised information for the action.

concept.name: Who
concept.description: Name and role (e.g. person, carer, GP, OT, etc.) of the person, or a team, carrying out the proposed action, and, if relevant where action should take place.

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional or person carrying out the proposed action.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role of the person providing the service.

concept.name: Team
concept.description: The name of the team.

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the professional (e.g. telephone number, email address etc.).

concept.name: When
concept.description: Planned date, time, or interval, as relevant

concept.name: Suggested strategies
concept.description: Suggested strategies for potential problems.

concept.name: Status
concept.description: The status of the action or activity e.g. in progress, done, refused

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the person's activity status
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - ^999000081000000105 | Care planning action context values simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Any supplementary or personalised information for the person's activity status

concept.name: Confidence
concept.description: How confident the person feels to carry out the action associated to the goal.

concept.name: Date last updated
concept.description: Date when action/activity record was last updated

concept.name: Review date
concept.description: When the action evaluation needs to be reviewed. SNOMED CT tag : - 425268008 | Review of care plan (procedure) |

concept.name: Stage goal
concept.description: Details of the person's stage goals

concept.name: Stage goal
concept.description: A specific sub-goal that is related to the overall goal as agreed by the person in collaboration with a professional.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded expression associated with the person's stage goal.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - 413350009|Finding with explicit context|: 246090004|Associated finding|=300798006 |Able to participate in sporting activities (finding)|, 408729009|Finding context|=410518001|Goal|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Any supplementary or personalised information regarding the person's stage goal.

concept.name: Outcome
concept.description: The outcome of the stage goal

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the person's stage goal outcome.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^1127601000000107 |Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Any supplementary and personalised information relating to the person's outcome.

concept.name: Goal status
concept.description: The status associated with the person's stage goal
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^999000091000000107 | Care planning goal context values simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Outcomes
concept.description: Outcomes of each of the person’s goals, aims and targets. Includes comments recorded by the person, date and status.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value associated with the person's overall goal outcome
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: -  ^1127601000000107 |Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Any supplementary and personalised information relating to the person's goal outcome.

concept.name: Goal status
concept.description: The status associated with the person's overall goal.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^999000091000000107 | Care planning goal context values simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

                     <br clear="none"/> This may include condition-specific plans, advance care plans, end of life care plan, etc.

concept.name: Contingency/safety plans
concept.description: These are the things to do and people to contact, should an individual’s health or other circumstances get worse for safety.

concept.name: Trigger factors
concept.description: Signs to watch out for that may indicate a significant change in health or other circumstances e.g. feeling agitated

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The trigger that leads to instigation of a significant change in health or other circumstances. <br clear="none"/>
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^1127581000000103 | Health issues simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Any free text associated with the person's trigger factor

concept.name: Contingency plan name
concept.description: When the action evaluation needs to be reviewed.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for the type of care plan
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - 999001471000000108 | Care plan type simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Free text if no coded value is available.

concept.name: What should happen
concept.description: Guidance on specific actions or interventions that may be required or should be avoided in specific situations. This may include circumstances where action needs to be taken if a carer is unable to care for the person. A statement of suggested actions. Usually expressed as: in the event of X do Y.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.description: The coded value for what should happen
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - <<71388002 |Procedure| OR <<129125009 |Procedure with explicit context|

concept.name: Free text
concept.description: Any supplementary or personalised information regarding what should happen
concept.valueSets: Free text

concept.name: Who should be contacted
concept.description: Who should be contacted in the event of significant problems or deterioration in health or wellbeing. e.g. name, role and contact details.

concept.description: The name of the professional with responsibility for the care of the person.

concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker, key worker, care home manager, care coordinator, LA hospital liaison person, care home contact, hospital clinician, Independent Mental Capacity Advocate (IMCA) etc

concept.name: Planned review date/interval
concept.description: This is the date/interval when this contingency plan will next be reviewed. SNOMED CT tag : - 425268008 | Review of care plan (procedure) |

concept.name: Responsibility for review
concept.description: This is who has responsibility for arranging review of this information. <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: Name
concept.description: The name of the professional with responsibility for the care of the person.

concept.name: Role
concept.description: The role the professional has in relation to the person e.g. GP, physiotherapist, community nurse, social worker, key worker, care home manager, care coordinator, LA hospital liaison person, care home contact, hospital clinician, Independent Mental Capacity Advocate (IMCA) etc

concept.name: Contact details
concept.description: Contact details of the professional (e.g. telephone number, email address etc.).

concept.name: Coping strategies
concept.description: Details of coping strategies used

concept.name: Coping strategy
concept.description: The coping strategies are defined as thoughts and behaviours that people use to manage the internal and external demands of situations that are appraised as stressful. This should also include a record of any tools used to carry out the coping strategy.

concept.name: Start date
concept.description: The date when the coping strategy started

concept.name: End date
concept.description: The date when the coping strategy ended

concept.name: Relapse indicators / early warning signs
concept.description: Details of the relapse indicators for the person. These may also be called 'early warning signs'

concept.name: Additional support plan content
concept.description: This is the content of any additional care and support plan which the person and/or care professional consider should be shared with others providing care and support. May be structured in different ways, e.g. tables, diagrams, images. This is the content of any additional care and support plan which the individual and/or care professional consider should be shared with others providing care and support. It should be structured as recommended for the care and support plan and if contains additional detail, it may be referenced here.
